title: Managing space domain awareness data has become a greater challenge than collecting it
summary:
Demand has never been greater for the monitoring of objects in orbit and the coordination of their safe movement. The number of active satellites in low Earth orbit (LEO) has surged from less than a thousand in 2019, when SpaceX began launching its colossal Starlink broadband constellation, to more than 10,000 today. As other megaconstellations […]

title: Isaacman renomination wins support from much of the space industry
summary:
The renomination of Jared Isaacman to be NASA administrator has been welcomed by much of the space industry, even as Isaacman defends positions he took in a policy manifesto.

title: Second New Glenn launch set for Nov. 9
summary:
Blue Origin says the second launch of its New Glenn rocket, carrying a pair of NASA Mars spacecraft, is scheduled for Nov. 9.

title: Rocket Lab launches sixth iQPS satellite
summary:
A Rocket Lab Electron rocket launched a radar imaging satellite for Japanese company iQPS on Nov. 5.

title: ESA’s HydroGNSS Scout satellites ready for launch
summary: After arriving at the California launch site at the end of September, the two HydroGNSS satellites have been carefully prepared for liftoff, scheduled this month.

title: Live coverage: ULA to launch ViaSat-3 communications satellite on Atlas 5 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: The mission is the second of three planned spacecraft that Viasat plans to operate in geostationary orbit. United Launch Alliance is targeting liftoff from pad 41 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station at 10:24 p.m. EST (0324 UTC).

title: ESA advances ERS program, marking shift toward dual-use and defense
summary:
Milan — The European Space Agency has refined its plan for the European Resilience from Space (ERS) program, outlining a €1 billion ($1.15 billion) framework that more directly ties Earth observation, telecommunications and navigation to Europe’s growing defense and security needs. The updated proposal will go before member states for approval at the Nov. 26–27 […]
